linkedin_data.name: Steve Howell, CFA, CMA, CPA
linkedin_data.headline: VP Treasurer (Interim)
linkedin_data.summary:
With 30+ years of high-level leadership experience in complex roles requiring exceptional project coordination, budgeting strategies, and management skills, I carry a wealth of business development tools for operational and financial leadership. With my skills in strategy development and process optimization, teams under my direction have accomplished top-level organizational objectives while cultivating positive workplace environments through talent management, lean methodologies, and interdepartmental communication structures. I have achieved millions in savings through process redesign, outsourcing, eliminating redundancies, and leading data-driven organizational improvement initiatives. I am also a strong communicator skilled at liaising with executive management teams and the Board of Directors to champion effective leadership practices at all levels.

A selection of my key accomplishments includes:
● I achieved $5 million in annual savings by outsourcing in-house anesthesia, emergency department, and hospitalist physicians.
● I collaborated in an ongoing effort to improve employed provider productivity levels from 25th to 50th MGMA percentiles by assessing, recommending, and integrating employed physician compensation models.
● I centralized all the banking and investment management relationships and reduced annual costs by over $1.2 million.
● In conjunction with external financial experts, I coordinated a $250 million bond issue to conduct due diligence, determine bond size, and develop a Single Obligated Group for a Master Trust Indenture. 
● I guided a team of internal analysts, outside attorneys, expert witnesses, and investment bankers to pursue damages from System’s previous management company, leading to a settlement of over $50 million.
● I avoided millions of dollars in interest costs by implementing $205M low-rate FHA 242 debt financing to expand a suburban hospital.

To learn more about my skills and qualifications, connect with me on LinkedIn.

experience.title: CFO Ochsner Baton Rouge/Lake Charles Region

description.text:
Howell Analytics, LLC was established in 2010 to serve two markets. First, healthcare industry clients of any size in need of specialized analyses and project coordination. Second, small and mid-sized companies (< $50 million sales) desiring value-added, sophisticated analytical services at affordable prices.  Howell Analytics also assists start-up companies complete the business planning and feasibility analyses they will need to become viable.  

Services provided include, but is not necessarily limited, to the following:

-Interim Executive Management
-Business Valuations
-Feasibility and Sustainability Plans
-Strategic Assessments & Plans
-Environmental Scans
-Business Plans
-Product Line evaluation and planning
-Cost Accounting system design
-Joint Venture evaluation, support and coordination
-Impact analyses
-Contract review assistance
-RFP construction, evaluation and management (if required)
-Legislative impact analysis

Howell Analytics typically works on an hourly basis, but will also price some services on a prospective basis. Hourly rates vary depending both upon the level of complexity and the size of each project.

I direct executive-level leadership for a $1.7 billion system supporting nine hospitals and 700+ employed providers and manage all financial and treasury functions as well as strategic projects, process improvement, and change management. 

My areas of focus are as follows:
Strategic Leadership
● Identified and implemented optimized financial structures to restructure critical access hospitals for improved performance. 
● Collaborated on vendor selection process to assess long-term ownership costs of new EMR system.
● Co-directed team to evaluate and improve underperforming retail system for pharmacy operations while securing 340B Drug Discount Program benefits.
● Developed five-year integrated strategic financial planning process to coordinate optimal operating performance with required system capital.
● Directed comprehensive evaluation and acquisition of MRI center.
Operational Leadership
● Led complex system analysis and optimization project to maximize tertiary hospital utilization and eliminate redundancy for specialist physician requirements. 
● Increased efficiency by reducing excess days at tertiary hospitals. 
Relationship Building – Board of Directors 
● Served as primary liaison between executive management team and Board of Directors in regular Investment Subcommittee meetings, including presenting investment results, coordinating periodic review of system Investment Policy Statement, and leading ad-hoc and cyclical analyses of Defined Benefit and Define Contribution pension plans.
● Acted as liaison with critical access hospital sub-boards to create develop financial strategies and restructuring plans to benefit the hospital systems and local communities. 
Financial Leadership
● Led Accounts Payable department to increase payment cycle times, reducing working capital requirements and increasing Days Cash on Hand.
● Eliminated redundancy to save costs, including reducing investment advisors from 10 to one and saving more than $500 thousand in fees.

section_components.caption: April 13, 2012, Will managed Steve directly
section_components.subtitle: Partner at Eide Bailly, LLP

fixedListComponent.text: I've known Steve for over twenty years, both in a supervisory role and, today, in a consultant-to-consultant relationship.  Anyone looking for an industry resource for project specific services will find him a great investment with immediate, high impact payback.  Steve functions well in a team environment and has strong expertise merging financial and operational skills honed through years of strong experience allowing him to add value to any situation. His strong work ethic accomplishes the typical project ahead of schedule. Analytically, he's a brilliant talent capable of learning independently on the fly.  This quality is an extraordinarily rare advantage for a consultant in our industry, which is constantly evolving as numerous sub-fields interact. Steve rolls up his sleeves everyday and learns the latest techniques and industry rules, but I judge his strongest talent as his ability to picture an analysis and its variables in his mind before numerically painting them in exquisite, understandable detail.  Over and over again I have seen him create new financial models complex enough to take all essential variables into place, but simple to understand and use in effectively communicating with various constituents.  Several examples will suffice.  During our time working together for an IDS ("Integrated Delivery System") in the early to mid-1990's, Steve successfully developed complex financial models for all of the System's entities that spanned the continuum from physician clinics, reference laboratories and nursing homes, to HMOs and acute care hospitals. He demonstrated an ability to learn the specific characteristics of each of the healthcare entities' sub-market segments on the run and on an independent basis. He successfully built models that incorporated data from our different companies so simultaneous projections could effectively be made.  For a time, we owned both an HMO and several acute care hospitals.  Steve built a model to show the overall impact of patient volume to the "System" as well as each company individually by effectively accounting for the incidence of "inter-company" profits. This led us to powerful insights in negotiating with "ourselves" and determining HMO rates for our hospitals. Another example of Steve's formidable skill was the development of a comprehensive financial modeling of a Long Term Acute Care space rental within our Baton Rouge facility in the early 1990's, complete with ancillary revenue impacts and related overhead costing on both a marginal and fully loaded basis.  His analytic skill sets in healthcare are as powerful in relation to physician alignment and group practice management evaluations as to primary and tertiary acute care development.  Steve is an invaluable resource my current firm turns to often for our most complex projects, particularly with regard to due diligence efforts involving a need for both rigorous analytics and a thorough understanding of strategic financial planning.

section_components.caption: January 13, 2012, Kim worked with Steve but on different teams
section_components.subtitle: Chief Executive Officer at Louisiana Women's Healthcare

fixedListComponent.text: Steve is a brilliant financial, operational and strategic resource.  Have been professionally connected to Steve Howell for years - he has been a relied upon, value-added, resource by senior executives and governing bodies for very credible decision support and guidance in many significant matters affecting enterprise-wide results.  Strong successful trackrecord of developing and managing cost accounting systems and cash forecasting models among other financial decsion support systems.  Experienced in financial feasibility studies and strategic business planning initiatives.

section_components.caption: October 25, 2011, Steve worked with Cindy but they were at different companies
section_components.subtitle: Chief Executive Officer at Louisiana Health Care Quality Forum

fixedListComponent.text: I have worked with Cindy as a colleague in a large acute care hospital and as a consultant for her in her new role of leading Louisiana's largest HIE.  Cindy's greatest strength is managing groups of people with a spectrum of skill sets in order to plan, complete and operate complex processes. She has demonstrated this skill, for example, by successfully planning for hurricanes in one of her former roles to having an HIE system stood-up and operational by a defined deadline in her new one. She has been successful in managing these groups as a result of her talent for choosing the right people to work for her or to bring in as consultants so that a cohesive team has formed once the project starts. She leads by example and has a fast learning curve meaning that she is able to learn enough new trend in relevant technical fields to provide required project guidance. The Louisiana Healthcare Quality Forum is lucky to have Cindy at the helm. I would readily endorse Cindy for any type of management position where creating and leading multi-sklled teams were the key to success.

section_components.caption: October 25, 2011, Steve worked with Brenda but they were at different companies
section_components.subtitle: Senior Manager at DaVita Kidney Care

fixedListComponent.text: I've worked with Brenda over the last six months where I have assisted her evaluate the financial implications of different strategic directions while she has led an effort to create a state sponsored HIE.  Her job is a demanding one as she has been under a tremendous amount of pressure from both numerous deadlines as well as this industry segment's "new" status which provides few examples of what works. Despite this she has been able to successfully coordinate the technical and financial aspects of this project and remain on schedule. I would strongly recommend Brenda for any type of senior level IT project management role. She has the necessary technical skills, but also shows a strong aptitude for the business/finance side of things.

Strategic Leadership

Operational Leadership

Relationship Building – Board of Directors

Financial Leadership

● Eliminated redundancy to save costs, including reducing investment advisors from 10 to one and saving more than $500 thousand in fees.

section_components.caption: April 13, 2012, Will managed Steve directly
section_components.subtitle: Partner at Eide Bailly, LLP

fixedListComponent.text: I've known Steve for over twenty years, both in a supervisory role and, today, in a consultant-to-consultant relationship.  Anyone looking for an industry resource for project specific services will find him a great investment with immediate, high impact payback.  Steve functions well in a team environment and has strong expertise merging financial and operational skills honed through years of strong experience allowing him to add value to any situation. His strong work ethic accomplishes the typical project ahead of schedule. Analytically, he's a brilliant talent capable of learning independently on the fly.  This quality is an extraordinarily rare advantage for a consultant in our industry, which is constantly evolving as numerous sub-fields interact. Steve rolls up his sleeves everyday and learns the latest techniques and industry rules, but I judge his strongest talent as his ability to picture an analysis and its variables in his mind before numerically painting them in exquisite, understandable detail.  Over and over again I have seen him create new financial models complex enough to take all essential variables into place, but simple to understand and use in effectively communicating with various constituents.  Several examples will suffice.  During our time working together for an IDS ("Integrated Delivery System") in the early to mid-1990's, Steve successfully developed complex financial models for all of the System's entities that spanned the continuum from physician clinics, reference laboratories and nursing homes, to HMOs and acute care hospitals. He demonstrated an ability to learn the specific characteristics of each of the healthcare entities' sub-market segments on the run and on an independent basis. He successfully built models that incorporated data from our different companies so simultaneous projections could effectively be made.  For a time, we owned both an HMO and several acute care hospitals.  Steve built a model to show the overall impact of patient volume to the "System" as well as each company individually by effectively accounting for the incidence of "inter-company" profits. This led us to powerful insights in negotiating with "ourselves" and determining HMO rates for our hospitals. Another example of Steve's formidable skill was the development of a comprehensive financial modeling of a Long Term Acute Care space rental within our Baton Rouge facility in the early 1990's, complete with ancillary revenue impacts and related overhead costing on both a marginal and fully loaded basis.  His analytic skill sets in healthcare are as powerful in relation to physician alignment and group practice management evaluations as to primary and tertiary acute care development.  Steve is an invaluable resource my current firm turns to often for our most complex projects, particularly with regard to due diligence efforts involving a need for both rigorous analytics and a thorough understanding of strategic financial planning.

section_components.caption: January 13, 2012, Kim worked with Steve but on different teams
section_components.subtitle: Chief Executive Officer at Louisiana Women's Healthcare

fixedListComponent.text: Steve is a brilliant financial, operational and strategic resource.  Have been professionally connected to Steve Howell for years - he has been a relied upon, value-added, resource by senior executives and governing bodies for very credible decision support and guidance in many significant matters affecting enterprise-wide results.  Strong successful trackrecord of developing and managing cost accounting systems and cash forecasting models among other financial decsion support systems.  Experienced in financial feasibility studies and strategic business planning initiatives.

section_components.caption: October 25, 2011, Steve worked with Cindy but they were at different companies
section_components.subtitle: Chief Executive Officer at Louisiana Health Care Quality Forum

fixedListComponent.text: I have worked with Cindy as a colleague in a large acute care hospital and as a consultant for her in her new role of leading Louisiana's largest HIE.  Cindy's greatest strength is managing groups of people with a spectrum of skill sets in order to plan, complete and operate complex processes. She has demonstrated this skill, for example, by successfully planning for hurricanes in one of her former roles to having an HIE system stood-up and operational by a defined deadline in her new one. She has been successful in managing these groups as a result of her talent for choosing the right people to work for her or to bring in as consultants so that a cohesive team has formed once the project starts. She leads by example and has a fast learning curve meaning that she is able to learn enough new trend in relevant technical fields to provide required project guidance. The Louisiana Healthcare Quality Forum is lucky to have Cindy at the helm. I would readily endorse Cindy for any type of management position where creating and leading multi-sklled teams were the key to success.

section_components.caption: October 25, 2011, Steve worked with Brenda but they were at different companies
section_components.subtitle: Senior Manager at DaVita Kidney Care

fixedListComponent.text: I've worked with Brenda over the last six months where I have assisted her evaluate the financial implications of different strategic directions while she has led an effort to create a state sponsored HIE.  Her job is a demanding one as she has been under a tremendous amount of pressure from both numerous deadlines as well as this industry segment's "new" status which provides few examples of what works. Despite this she has been able to successfully coordinate the technical and financial aspects of this project and remain on schedule. I would strongly recommend Brenda for any type of senior level IT project management role. She has the necessary technical skills, but also shows a strong aptitude for the business/finance side of things.

experience.title: Vice President of Medical Group Finance

description.text: Oversaw planning, coordination, and direction of financial activities for Valley Health Medical Group with a focus on supporting successful attainment of operational and strategic objectives. Lead development and execution of controls within a highly sophisticated regulatory and healthcare revenue cycle environment in addition to physician compensation.

Served as Director of Finance for three hospitals and a multispecialty physician group. Directed activities related to annual financial cycle for the region; oversaw budget, routine and strategic capital management, long range financial planning, and financial and productivity analysis. Led development of business plans and proposals to establish new clinical services; skilled in evaluating staffing needs with a focus on maximizing regional revenue opportunities. 

Developed physician compensation plans; coordinated submissions to benchmarking organizations and advised on compensation philosophy. Developed system-wide strategy and implementation plan designed to address referral leakage. 

Drove innovation by developing a multi-year workforce and succession plan for provider recruitment. Generated stability by creating and piloting system-wide dashboards for incident command and provider COVID-19 reassignments. Led development of system-wide strategies designed to create a unified provider compensation philosophy across four physician groups at 4K providers and address physician fee schedule changes.

Directed the division of Financial Services, including Business Services, Financial Analysis and Budget, and Financial Accounting and Reporting. Managed the relationship between the IUSM and the IU Foundation endowment. Provided vital structure by designing and directing production of complex financial and operational reports for internal and external stakeholders; developed standard metrics and reports in Tableau to support accreditation and enterprise funds flow operations. 

Oversaw strategic use of operational funds.; advised CFO on opportunities to advance cash strategy by maximizing use of restricted resources; established long-range financial plans for funding capital projects and long-term commitments. Directed all of IU Medical Group Foundation operations, including daily operations, investment management, board meetings, and annual audit.

Who do you think of when you envision your future work-self? I would love to help you become that person! Posting a role for a new team member at MedStar Washington Hospital Center is creating nostalgia for the best-in-class colleagues that I've had the luck to recruit first in my prior roles - there's always something special about your first! (Yes, Brandon Mathis - I'm talking about you!) 

The Senior Finance Business Partner with the MWHC team will gain experience at an academic medical center and Level 1 Trauma center - a fertile ground for curious minds and ambitious learners. MedStar is the largest health system in the DMV area, in addition to being truly committed to community programs based on research on social determinants of health. I cannot wait to get in deeper and find all of the treasures that MedStar has to teach me - would you like to join? See link below to get started!

experience.title: Senior Director, Finance Operations, MedStar Medical Group

description.text: Leads Financial Planning and Analysis for Hospital Aligned Physician Practices.  Works collaboratively with Physicians and Operations leaders as a teacher, coach, mentor, and trusted advisor to optimize financial performance.

Act as financial liaison for over ninety key operational departments within a not-for-profit 400-bed community teaching hospital.
Coordinate the accurate and timely development of the fiscal operating budget and conduct monthly actual to plan variance analysis for key departments, incorporating projection of volumes, revenue, salary, and non-manpower expenses.
Collaborate with Strategic Planning and Senior Management to assist in the preparation and submission of a cohesive long-range financial forecast, with special focus on volumes, revenue, and contributions.
Manage Decision Support System process, involving data collection and validation, model set-up, preparation and loading of reclassifications and statistical allocations, performing calculations, and completing reconciliations.  Utilize data to provide Corporate Finance with service line profitability and special requests.  
Prepare return on investment business plans, documenting supporting assumptions, to aide Senior Management in decision making regarding profitability and growth opportunities.
Analyze financial statements during the monthly close process to ensure complete, accurate, timely, and appropriate financial reporting to management, specifically completing drill down and trending analysis of monthly Case Mix Index by Product Line, Other Operating Revenue, and Salary Expense.
Partner with Case Management, Risk Management, and Rates and Reimbursement to monitor pay for performance methodologies, as it relates to Readmissions and Potentially Preventable Conditions.
Seek opportunities for improvement and establish productivity targets utilizing the Action O-I national benchmarking tool and Kaufman Hall productivity tool.
Collaborate with Internal Audit regarding payroll and accounts payable investigations.
Educate new leaders on financial reporting and the budgeting process.  Mentor fellow associates.

Embraced multiple reorganizations gaining experience in Financial Planning and Analysis, Managed Care Analysis, and Actuarial Reporting.  Mentored and trained fellow associates, supervised interns, and acted as a team leader.
Coordinated the accurate and timely development of the corporate financial plan and investigated monthly actual to plan trends, volume/rate, and product mix variances, creating various models to perform “what if” analyses.
Designed and analyzed cost of care and financial/actuarial reports for upper management or external release, under critical time restraints, including profit/loss statements, detailed cost allocation models, annual statement exhibits, and other regulatory reports.
Successfully led Actuarial/Financial Reporting team in monthly close process, involving estimation of incurred but not reported (IBNR) for all entities, segments and products, incorporating chain and ladder model.
Developed and maintained database for use in planning, segment reporting/monitoring, and drill down analysis.
Communicated with hospitals regarding advance financing and represented team on Substantial, Available and Affordable Coverage (SAAC) task force.
Assisted the Actuarial Pricing team through coordination of a competitive pricing analysis, development and testing of rates, and answering broker inquiries.
Organized special ad hoc financial projects, analyzed corporate and industry trends, prepared statistics used in the request for proposal process, and supported financial settlements and external audit.
Prepared numerous presentations for upper management.

raw_data.headline: Senior Director, Finance Operations at MEDSTAR MEDICAL GROUP
raw_data.jobTitle: Senior Director, Finance Operations, MedStar Medical Group
raw_data.addressWithCountry: Baltimore City County, Maryland, United States
raw_data.about:
Ambitious leader and exceptional team player with over 27 years of healthcare finance experience.
Excellent service, interpersonal, and communication skills with all levels of an organization.
Innovatively proficient in preparing, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data.
Outstanding time management and organizational skills with ability to multi-task and problem solve in dynamic environments.

experiences.title: Senior Director, Finance Operations, MedStar Medical Group
experiences.subtitle: MedStar Health · Full-time
experiences.caption: Jul 2020 - Present · 5 yrs 4 mos

description.text: Leads Financial Planning and Analysis for Hospital Aligned Physician Practices.  Works collaboratively with Physicians and Operations leaders as a teacher, coach, mentor, and trusted advisor to optimize financial performance.

Act as financial liaison for over ninety key operational departments within a not-for-profit 400-bed community teaching hospital.
Coordinate the accurate and timely development of the fiscal operating budget and conduct monthly actual to plan variance analysis for key departments, incorporating projection of volumes, revenue, salary, and non-manpower expenses.
Collaborate with Strategic Planning and Senior Management to assist in the preparation and submission of a cohesive long-range financial forecast, with special focus on volumes, revenue, and contributions.
Manage Decision Support System process, involving data collection and validation, model set-up, preparation and loading of reclassifications and statistical allocations, performing calculations, and completing reconciliations.  Utilize data to provide Corporate Finance with service line profitability and special requests.  
Prepare return on investment business plans, documenting supporting assumptions, to aide Senior Management in decision making regarding profitability and growth opportunities.
Analyze financial statements during the monthly close process to ensure complete, accurate, timely, and appropriate financial reporting to management, specifically completing drill down and trending analysis of monthly Case Mix Index by Product Line, Other Operating Revenue, and Salary Expense.
Partner with Case Management, Risk Management, and Rates and Reimbursement to monitor pay for performance methodologies, as it relates to Readmissions and Potentially Preventable Conditions.
Seek opportunities for improvement and establish productivity targets utilizing the Action O-I national benchmarking tool and Kaufman Hall productivity tool.
Collaborate with Internal Audit regarding payroll and accounts payable investigations.
Educate new leaders on financial reporting and the budgeting process.  Mentor fellow associates.

Embraced multiple reorganizations gaining experience in Financial Planning and Analysis, Managed Care Analysis, and Actuarial Reporting.  Mentored and trained fellow associates, supervised interns, and acted as a team leader.
Coordinated the accurate and timely development of the corporate financial plan and investigated monthly actual to plan trends, volume/rate, and product mix variances, creating various models to perform “what if” analyses.
Designed and analyzed cost of care and financial/actuarial reports for upper management or external release, under critical time restraints, including profit/loss statements, detailed cost allocation models, annual statement exhibits, and other regulatory reports.
Successfully led Actuarial/Financial Reporting team in monthly close process, involving estimation of incurred but not reported (IBNR) for all entities, segments and products, incorporating chain and ladder model.
Developed and maintained database for use in planning, segment reporting/monitoring, and drill down analysis.
Communicated with hospitals regarding advance financing and represented team on Substantial, Available and Affordable Coverage (SAAC) task force.
Assisted the Actuarial Pricing team through coordination of a competitive pricing analysis, development and testing of rates, and answering broker inquiries.
Organized special ad hoc financial projects, analyzed corporate and industry trends, prepared statistics used in the request for proposal process, and supported financial settlements and external audit.
Prepared numerous presentations for upper management.
